com.stormpath.sdk.directory

Interface PasswordStrength

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Resource, Saveable

    public interface PasswordStrength
extends Resource, Saveable
    PasswordStrength is the resource used to configure the password strength policy. This policy defines requirements like minimum uppercase chars or maximum password length (among others) and will enforced by Stormpath when setting or resetting accounts' passwords.
    Since:
    1.0.RC4

    • Method Detail

      • getMinSymbol

        int getMinSymbol()
        Return the minimum quantity of symbols required by this policy.

        This is the complete list of symbols supported: space, !, ", #, $, %, &, ', (, ), *, +, comma, -, ., /, :, ;, <, =, >, @, [, \, ], ^, _, {, |, }, ~, ¡, §, ©, «, ¬, ® , ±, µ, ¶, ·, », ½, ¿, ×, ÷.
        Returns:
        the minimum quantity of symbols required by this policy.

      • setMinSymbol

        PasswordStrength setMinSymbol(int minSymbol)
        Specifies the minimum quantity of symbols required by this policy.

        This is the complete list of symbols supported: space, !, ", #, $, %, &, ', (, ), *, +, comma, -, ., /, :, ;, <, =, >, @, [, \, ], ^, _, {, |, }, ~, ¡, §, ©, «, ¬, ® , ±, µ, ¶, ·, », ½, ¿, ×, ÷.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getMinDiacritic

        int getMinDiacritic()
        Return the minimum quantity of diacritic characters required by this policy.

        This is the complete list of diacritic characters supported: À, Á, Â, Ã, Ä, Å, Æ, Ç, È, É, Ê, Ë, Ì, Í, Î, Ï, Ð, Ñ, Ò, Ó, Ô, Õ, Ö, Ø, Ù, Ú, Û, Ü, Ý, Þ, ß, à, á, â, ã, ä, å, æ, ç, è, é, ê, ë, ì, í, î, ï, ð, ñ, ò, ó, ô, õ, ö, ø, ù, ú, û, ü, ý, þ, ÿ.
        Returns:
        the minimum quantity of diacritic characters required by this policy.

      • setMinDiacritic

        PasswordStrength setMinDiacritic(int minDiacritic)
        Specifies the minimum quantity of diacritic characters required by this policy.

        This is the complete list of diacritic characters supported: À, Á, Â, Ã, Ä, Å, Æ, Ç, È, É, Ê, Ë, Ì, Í, Î, Ï, Ð, Ñ, Ò, Ó, Ô, Õ, Ö, Ø, Ù, Ú, Û, Ü, Ý, Þ, ß, à, á, â, ã, ä, å, æ, ç, è, é, ê, ë, ì, í, î, ï, ð, ñ, ò, ó, ô, õ, ö, ø, ù, ú, û, ü, ý, þ, ÿ.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getMinUpperCase

        int getMinUpperCase()
        Returns the minimum quantity of uppercase characters (i.e. A, B, C, ... Z) required by this policy.
        Returns:
        the minimum quantity of uppercase characters required by this policy.

      • getMaxLength

        int getMaxLength()
        Returns the maximum quantity of total characters allowed in a password by this policy.
        Returns:
        the maximum quantity of total characters allowed in a password by this policy.

      • setMaxLength

        PasswordStrength setMaxLength(int maxLength)
        Specifies the maximum quantity of total characters allowed in a password by this policy.

        The maximum allowed password length is 1024 characters.

        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getMinNumeric

        int getMinNumeric()
        Returns the minimum quantity of numeric characters (i.e. 0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9) required by this policy.
        Returns:
        the minimum quantity of numeric characters required by this policy.

      • setMinNumeric

        PasswordStrength setMinNumeric(int minNumeric)
        Specifies the minimum quantity of numeric characters (i.e. 0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9) required by this policy.

        this instance for method chaining.
